dict.string: This is a quick guide to walk you through the different parts of Breathe2Relax. Just start at the top of the list. Cancel if you just want to explore on your own. Press Guide Me to bring the guide back.

This is Breathe2Relax's main screen. From here you can watch a demonstration of diaphramatic breathing, learn about stress and its effects through reading or watching videos. Most importantly, you can practice a breathing session.
Learn about diaphragmatic breathing. Watch videos and view the interactive body browser to learn more about the effects of stress on your body.
As you breathe to relax you can set how much stress you feel before and after the breathing exercise and over time you should see how the breathing is helping you reduce stress.

You'll be guided through a deep breathing exercise. Before we begin, please use this stress tracker to quickly rate how stressed you are. You will be asked again to repeat your stress level after the breathing exercise.
Please use this stress tracker to quickly rate how stressed you are after the breathing session.

This breathing exercise is safe for almost everybody. But if you experience any unpleasant sensations, if you have difficulty breathing or feeling dizzy, nervous or out of control. Then go back to breathing normally. Remember that the purpose of this exercise is to help you learn how to slow down and relax. You can shorten or lengthen the time of each breath to make it more comfortable for you. Press start when ready to begin.
If you are finished with the breathing session then press Proceed. You will be presented with a stress tracker to record how you feel after the deep breathing session. Unless you skipped it before.
